result.execSummary:
The defendant Erin G Diehm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Erin G Diehm is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Erin G Diehm was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Sign up for probation no later than 10/11/12.
Probation may be terminated early if deemed appropriate by the agent.

miscConds.notes:
No contact with Meijers.
No new law violations  rising to the level of probable cause.
No prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

Submit a DNA sample by 10/11/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erin G Diehm

defendant.name: Diehm, Erin G
defendant.address: 2222 East Excalibur Court, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.  rmm

Defendant Erin G Diehm in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Erin G Diehm.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the state, Court ordered Count 2 dismissed.
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 0 days time served, Huber Privileges for work. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 9 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 10/11/22.
- No contact with Meijers.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Obtain/maintain full time work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/11/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal. 

Probation may be terminated early if deemed appropriate by the agent.

Defendant Erin G Diehm in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Calendar Call. Based on defendant's appearance in Court, Court vacates the stayed bench warrant.
Defense counsel requests plea/sentencing hearing.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 1. 
Plea/Sentencing Hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Sam Obscherning in court.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom.  Case set for status conference.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  Calendar call scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Erin G Diehm in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Erin G Diehm appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for status. Defense needs to review discovery and offer and requests an adjournment. Case adjourned to br 01.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Erin G Diehm in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Obscherning has received discovery and an offer and requests time to review it.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Erin G Diehm in court.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge  Davila, Branch 1.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 1 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  Meijer Foods
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/12/2022@2:00pm
